title: SEE 2081 English Practice Test 4
subject: english
instructionsEnglish: Candidates are required to answer the questions in their own words as far as practicable. Figures in the margin indicate the full marks. Attempt all the questions.

questions.title: Read the poem and do the tasks.

passage.title: The Voice of the Rain
passage.author: Walt Whitman
passage.content:
And who art thou? said I to the soft-falling shower,
Which, strange to tell, gave me an answer, as here translated:
I am the Poem of Earth, said the voice of the rain,
Eternal I rise impalpable out of the land and the bottomless sea,
Upward to heaven, whence, vaguely form'd, altogether changed, and yet the same.
I descend to lave the droughts, atomies, dust-layers of the globe,
And all that in them without me were seeds only, latent, unborn:
And forever, by day and night, I give back life to my own origin,
and make pure and beautify it:
(For song, issuing from its birth-place, after fulfilment, wandering,
Reck'd or unreck'd, duly with love returns.)

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Who are the two speakers in the poem?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The two speakers are the poet and the rain.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविता कवि र वर्षा बीचको कुराकानी हो, जहाँ कविले प्रश्न सोध्छन् ("And who art thou?") र वर्षाले उत्तर दिन्छ ("I am the Poem of Earth...")।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem is a conversation between the poet and the rain, where the poet asks a question ("And who art thou?") and the rain gives an answer ("I am the Poem of Earth..."). Citations: chapter 5, page 77.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How does the rain rise from the earth?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The rain rises eternally and impalpably (in the form of vapour) from the land and the sea.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले भन्छ, "Eternal I rise impalpable out of the land and the bottomless sea," जसको अर्थ हो कि वर्षा वाष्पको रूपमा भूमि र समुद्रबाट निरन्तर र अदृश्य रूपमा माथि उठ्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem states, "Eternal I rise impalpable out of the land and the bottomless sea," which means the rain rises continuously and invisibly as vapour from the land and sea. Citations: chapter 5, page 77.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the function of the rain?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The function of the rain is to wash away droughts and dust and to give life to unborn seeds.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविता अनुसार, वर्षाले खडेरी र धुलोलाई पखाल्छ ("lave the droughts, atomies, dust-layers") र नजन्मेका बीउहरूलाई जीवन दिन्छ ("all that in them without me were seeds only, latent, unborn").
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: According to the poem, the rain washes away drought and dust ("lave the droughts, atomies, dust-layers") and gives life to seeds that were latent and unborn. Citations: chapter 5, page 77.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How is the rain similar to a song?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It is similar to a song because, like a song that returns to its origin with love, the rain also returns to its origin (the Earth) to beautify it.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको अन्तिम दुई पङ्क्तिले गीत र वर्षाको तुलना गर्दछ, दुवै आफ्नो उद्गम स्थलमा प्रेमका साथ फर्किन्छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The last two lines of the poem compare the rain to a song, stating that both return to their place of origin with love. Citations: chapter 5, page 77.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does the phrase 'altogether changed, and yet the same' mean?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It means that the rain changes its form from water to vapour and cloud, but its essence or core nature as water remains the same.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: यस वाक्यांशको अर्थ हो कि वर्षाले पानीबाट वाष्प र बादलमा आफ्नो रूप परिवर्तन गर्दछ, तर पानीको रूपमा यसको मूल सार उस्तै रहन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The phrase means that the rain changes its form from water to vapour and cloud, but its fundamental essence as water remains the same. Citations: chapter 5, page 77.

questions.title: Read the text and do the tasks.

passage.title: How Driverless Cars will Change our World
passage.content:
It's a late night in the Metro area of Phoenix, Arizona. Under the artificial glare of street lamps, a car can be seen slowly approaching. A green and blue 'W' glows from the windscreen, giving off just enough light to see inside - to a completely empty driver seat. This is a Waymo One robotaxi, hailed just 10 minutes ago using an app.

The promise of driverless technology has long been enticing. It has the potential to transform our experience of commuting, take people out of high-risk working environments and streamline our industries. It's key to helping us build the cities of the future, where our reliance on cars is redefined, lowering carbon emissions. And it could make our travel safer. The World Health Organization estimates that more than 1.3 million people die each year as a result of road traffic crashes.

But in order for driverless technology to become mainstream, much still needs to change. 'Driverless vehicles should be a very calm and serene way of getting from A to B. But not every human driver around it will be behaving in that way,' says David Hynd, a chief scientist. 'It's got to be able to cope with human drivers speeding, for instance, or breaking the rules of the road.' And that's not the only challenge. There's regulation, rethinking the Highway Code, public perception, and the big question of ultimate liability for road accidents.

subSections.title: Fill in the blanks with the correct information from the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: A Waymo One robotaxi can be hailed using an __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: app
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ कि वेमो वन रोबोट्याक्सीलाई "hailed just 10 minutes ago using an app" अर्थात् एउटा एप प्रयोग गरेर बोलाइएको थियो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions that the Waymo One robotaxi was "hailed just 10 minutes ago using an app." Citations: chapter 1, page 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Driverless technology can help in lowering __________ emissions.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: carbon
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि चालकविहीन प्रविधिले "lowering carbon emissions" अर्थात् कार्बन उत्सर्जन घटाउन मद्दत गर्न सक्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states that driverless technology can help in "lowering carbon emissions." Citations: chapter 1, page 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to the WHO, over 1.3 million people die annually in __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: road traffic crashes
subQuestions.explanationNepali: विश्व स्वास्थ्य संगठनको अनुमान अनुसार, "more than 1.3 million people die each year as a result of road traffic crashes."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The World Health Organization estimates that "more than 1.3 million people die each year as a result of road traffic crashes." Citations: chapter 1, page 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: One challenge for driverless cars is coping with human drivers who break the __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: rules of the road
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले उल्लेख गर्दछ कि चालकविहीन कारहरूले "human drivers ... breaking the rules of the road" को सामना गर्न सक्षम हुनुपर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text notes that driverless cars must be able to cope with "human drivers ... breaking the rules of the road." Citations: chapter 1, page 3.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The question of ultimate __________ for accidents is a major challenge.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: liability
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले "the big question of ultimate liability for road accidents" लाई एउटा ठूलो चुनौतीको रूपमा उल्लेख गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions "the big question of ultimate liability for road accidents" as a major challenge. Citations: chapter 1, page 3.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is a unique feature of the Waymo One robotaxi mentioned in the first paragraph?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Its unique feature is having a completely empty driver seat.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पहिलो अनुच्छेदले ट्याक्सीको भित्र "a completely empty driver seat" भएको वर्णन गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first paragraph describes the taxi as having "a completely empty driver seat" inside. Citations: chapter 1, page 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: List two potential benefits of driverless technology.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Two potential benefits are making travel safer and lowering carbon emissions.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले चालकविहीन प्रविधिका धेरै फाइदाहरू उल्लेख गरेको छ, जसमा "lowering carbon emissions" र "make our travel safer" समावेश छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions several benefits of driverless technology, including "lowering carbon emissions" and that it could "make our travel safer." Citations: chapter 1, page 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to David Hynd, how should a journey in a driverless vehicle feel?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It should be a very calm and serene way of getting from A to B.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: डेभिड हाइन्डका अनुसार, चालकविहीन गाडीमा यात्रा "a very calm and serene way of getting from A to B" हुनुपर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: According to David Hynd, a journey in a driverless vehicle should be "a very calm and serene way of getting from A to B." Citations: chapter 1, page 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Besides dealing with human drivers, name two other challenges for driverless technology.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Two other challenges are regulation and public perception.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले चालकविहीन प्रविधिका लागि "regulation" र "public perception" जस्ता अन्य चुनौतीहरू सूचीबद्ध गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text lists other challenges for driverless technology, such as "regulation" and "public perception." Citations: chapter 1, page 3.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the main idea of the text?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The main idea is that driverless cars offer significant potential benefits but face major challenges before they can become mainstream.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले चालकविहीन कारका फाइदाहरू (जस्तै सुरक्षा, कम उत्सर्जन) र चुनौतीहरू (जस्तै मानव चालकहरू, नियमहरू) दुवैको बारेमा छलफल गर्दछ, जसले यो मुख्य विचारलाई संकेत गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text discusses both the benefits of driverless cars (e.g., safety, lower emissions) and the challenges (e.g., human drivers, regulation), indicating this main idea. Citations: chapter 1, pages 2-3.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Call for Expression of Interest for Video Production
passage.content:
Notice Publication date: 03 January, 2025

Child Fund Japan Nepal Office (CFJNO) is a child-focused international development organization committed to promoting the rights of children. CFJNO is seeking interested and eligible External Individual Consultants or Consulting Firms in Nepal to provide video production services for two assignments:

1. To document the transformative impact and capture the achievement and milestones of the sponsorship programme, showcasing their role in driving sustainable educational development in Dhading and Sindhupalchowk districts.
2. Documenting the impact of migration on children, schools and community in Baglung district.

The proposals for both assignments must be written in English and submitted through a single application. Interested Nepali firms/organizations or individuals can submit their Expression of Interest (EOI). Please submit your EOI and the required documents electronically to info@childfund.org.np. Proposals received after the deadline will not be considered.

Deadline for submission: 12 January, 2025 before 17:00 hours Nepal Time.

All rights are reserved with CFJNO either to approve or disapprove any proposal without giving reasons whatsoever.

subSections.title: Write 'TRUE' for true, 'FALSE' for false, or 'NOT GIVEN' if the information is not in the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The notice was published on the 12th of January, 2025.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा स्पष्ट रूपमा "Notice Publication date: 03 January, 2025" भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice clearly states, "Notice Publication date: 03 January, 2025." Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: CFJNO works mainly for the welfare of women.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि CFJNO "is a child-focused international development organization," जसको अर्थ हो कि यो बालबालिकामा केन्द्रित छ, महिलामा होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states that CFJNO "is a child-focused international development organization," meaning it focuses on children, not women. Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The video production service is required for three different districts.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले धादिङ, सिन्धुपाल्चोक, र बागलुङ गरी तीन जिल्लाहरू उल्लेख गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions three districts: Dhading, Sindhupalchowk, and Baglung. Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Applicants must be from Japan.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा भनिएको छ, "Interested Nepali firms/organizations or individuals can submit their Expression of Interest," जसको अर्थ आवेदकहरू नेपाली हुनुपर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice states, "Interested Nepali firms/organizations or individuals can submit their Expression of Interest," meaning applicants must be Nepali. Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The selected consultant will be paid in US dollars.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: NOT GIVEN
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा भुक्तानीको मुद्रा (currency) बारे कुनै जानकारी दिइएको छैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice does not provide any information about the currency of payment. Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the full form of EOI?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The full form of EOI is Expression of Interest.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले "Expression of Interest (EOI)" लाई कोष्ठक प्रयोग गरेर परिभाषित गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text defines "Expression of Interest (EOI)" using parenthesis. Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the main goal of Child Fund Japan Nepal Office?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Its main goal is to promote the rights of children.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि CFJNO "is committed to promoting the rights of children."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states that CFJNO "is committed to promoting the rights of children." Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What should be documented in Dhading and Sindhupalchowk districts?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The transformative impact and achievements of the sponsorship programme should be documented.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पहिलो कार्यमा "document the transformative impact and capture the achievement and milestones of the sponsorship programme" भनेर उल्लेख गरिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first assignment is to "document the transformative impact and capture the achievement and milestones of the sponsorship programme." Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How must the proposals be submitted?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They must be submitted electronically to the given email address.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनाले "submit your EOI and the required documents electronically to info@childfund.org.np" भनेर निर्देशन दिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice instructs to "submit your EOI and the required documents electronically to info@childfund.org.np." Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What will happen if a proposal is submitted after the deadline?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It will not be considered for evaluation.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले स्पष्ट रूपमा भन्छ, "The proposal received after the deadline will not be considered for evaluation."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text clearly says, "The proposal received after the deadline will not be considered for evaluation." Citations: page 9 of All English Exams.pdf

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: A Century of World Population Trends: 1950 to 2050
passage.content:
Today, the world's population is more than three times larger than it was in the mid-twentieth century. It took around 37 years since 1950 for human numbers to double, surpassing 5 billion inhabitants in 1987. Since 1965, the pace of population growth has slowed by more than half owing to reduced levels of fertility. In 2020, the rate of population growth fell below one percent per year and it is projected to continue to slow.

The world's two most populous regions in 2022 were Eastern and South-Eastern Asia (2.3 billion people) and Central and Southern Asia (2.1 billion people). China and India accounted for the largest populations in these regions, with more than 1.4 billion each in 2022. However, Central and Southern Asia is expected to become the most populous region by 2037.

Between 2022 and 2050, the population of sub-Saharan Africa is expected to almost double, surpassing two billion inhabitants by the late 2040s. With average fertility levels remaining high, sub-Saharan Africa is projected to account for more than half of the growth of the world's population between 2022 and 2050.

More than half of the projected increase in the global population up to 2050 is expected to be concentrated in just eight countries: The Democratic Republic of the Congo, Egypt, Ethiopia, India, Nigeria, Pakistan, the Philippines and the United Republic of Tanzania. Disparate population growth rates among the world's largest countries will change their ranking by size: For example, India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023.

subSections.title: Match the words in Column ‘A’ with their meanings in Column ‘B’.

B.text: essentially different; of a different kind

subSections.explanationNepali: यी शब्दहरूको अर्थ पाठको सन्दर्भमा आधारित छन्। 'Surpassing' को अर्थ 'पार गर्नु', 'fertility' को अर्थ 'प्रजनन क्षमता', 'projected' को अर्थ 'अनुमानित', 'populous' को अर्थ 'धेरै जनसंख्या भएको', र 'disparate' को अर्थ 'भिन्न' हो।
subSections.explanationEnglish: The meanings of these words are based on their context in the text. 'Surpassing' means to exceed, 'fertility' means the ability to have children, 'projected' means estimated, 'populous' means having a large population, and 'disparate' means different. Citations: chapter 13, pages 206-208.

subSections.title: Put the following sentences in the correct order.

sentences.text: India is expected to become the most populous country.
The global population growth rate fell below one percent.
The pace of population growth started to slow down.
Central and Southern Asia is projected to be the most populous region.

subSections.explanationNepali: पाठ अनुसार, घटनाहरूको क्रम हो: जनसंख्या वृद्धिदर घट्न थाल्यो (1965 पछि), जनसंख्या ५ अर्ब पुग्यो (1987), वृद्धिदर १ प्रतिशतभन्दा कम भयो (2020), भारत सबैभन्दा बढी जनसंख्या भएको देश बन्ने अनुमान (2023), र मध्य/दक्षिण एसिया सबैभन्दा बढी जनसंख्या भएको क्षेत्र बन्ने अनुमान (2037)।
subSections.explanationEnglish: According to the text, the sequence of events is: the growth rate began to slow (after 1965), the population hit 5 billion (1987), the growth rate fell below 1% (2020), India is projected to become the most populous country (2023), and Central/Southern Asia is projected to be the most populous region (2037). Citations: chapter 13, pages 206-208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What was the primary reason for the slowing pace of population growth after 1965?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The primary reason was reduced levels of fertility.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "the pace of population growth has slowed by more than half owing to reduced levels of fertility."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "the pace of population growth has slowed by more than half owing to reduced levels of fertility." Citations: chapter 13, page 206.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Which were the two most populous regions in the world in 2022?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They were Eastern and South-Eastern Asia, and Central and Southern Asia.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले २०२२ मा विश्वका दुई सबैभन्दा बढी जनसंख्या भएका क्षेत्रहरू "Eastern and South-Eastern Asia" र "Central and Southern Asia" भनेर उल्लेख गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions the two most populous regions in 2022 were "Eastern and South-Eastern Asia" and "Central and Southern Asia." Citations: chapter 13, page 206.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Which region is projected to contribute most to the world's population growth by 2050?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Sub-Saharan Africa is projected to contribute the most.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले अनुमान गरेको छ कि उप-सहारा अफ्रिकाले "account for more than half of the growth of the world's population between 2022 and 2050."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text projects that sub-Saharan Africa will "account for more than half of the growth of the world's population between 2022 and 2050." Citations: chapter 13, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Name any two of the eight countries where most of the population increase is expected by 2050.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Any two from: India, Nigeria, Pakistan, Egypt, Ethiopia, the Philippines, the DR Congo, and Tanzania.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले आठ देशहरूको सूची दिएको छ जहाँ जनसंख्या वृद्धि केन्द्रित हुने अपेक्षा गरिएको छ, जसमा भारत र नाइजेरिया समावेश छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text lists eight countries where population growth is expected to be concentrated, including India and Nigeria. Citations: chapter 13, page 208.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What major change in population ranking is projected for 2023?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text says, "India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023." Citations: chapter 13, page 208.

questions.title: Write a short travelogue about a place you have recently visited.

sampleAnswer.title: A Memorable Trip to Lumbini
sampleAnswer.content: Last month, I had the opportunity to visit Lumbini, the birthplace of Lord Buddha. We travelled from Kathmandu by bus, a journey that was long but filled with beautiful sights of Nepal's countryside. Upon arriving, the sense of peace was immediate. The main attraction, the sacred garden, with the Ashoka Pillar and the Mayadevi Temple, was truly serene. We also explored the monastic zone, where different countries have built beautiful monasteries in their own architectural styles. My experience was deeply spiritual and calming. I highly recommend everyone to visit this UNESCO World Heritage site to experience its tranquillity.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले लुम्बिनीको भ्रमणको बारेमा एक छोटो यात्रा विवरण प्रस्तुत गर्दछ, दिइएको संकेतहरू प्रयोग गर्दै। यसमा स्थानको नाम, यात्राको माध्यम, मुख्य आकर्षणहरू, र लेखकको अनुभव समावेश छ। यसले पाठकलाई स्थानको शान्तिपूर्ण र आध्यात्मिक वातावरणको झलक दिन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents a short travelogue about a visit to Lumbini, using the provided clues. It includes the name of the place, mode of travel, main attractions, and the writer's experience. It gives the reader a glimpse of the peaceful and spiritual atmosphere of the location. Citations: chapter 14, page 233.

questions.title: Imagine your school is organizing an Inter-House Quiz Contest next week. Write a notice to inform the students about it.

sampleAnswer.title: NOTICE: Inter-House Quiz Contest
sampleAnswer.content:
This is to inform all students of grades 8, 9, and 10 that our school is organizing an Inter-House Quiz Contest next week. The details are as follows:

Date: 20th September, 2025
Time: 11:00 AM onwards
Venue: School Auditorium

The quiz will cover topics from science, history, and general knowledge. Each house can send one team of three members. Interested students are requested to register their team names with the undersigned by 18th September. All students are encouraged to attend and support their respective houses.

(Your Name)
Cultural Secretary
Student Council
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले अन्तर-सदन हाजिरीजवाफ प्रतियोगिताको बारेमा विद्यार्थीहरूलाई जानकारी दिनको लागि एक सूचना तयार गर्दछ। यसले कार्यक्रमको मिति, समय, स्थान, सहभागीहरू, र दर्ता विवरणहरू जस्ता सबै आवश्यक जानकारीहरू समावेश गर्दछ, दिइएको संकेतहरूमा आधारित।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer prepares a notice to inform students about an inter-house quiz contest. It includes all necessary details like the date, time, venue, participants, and registration details, based on the provided clues. Citations: chapter 12, page 208.

questions.title: Write a dialogue between two friends discussing the pros and cons of online classes in at least six exchanges.

sampleAnswer.content:
Anita: Hi Sameer! How are you finding these online classes?

Sameer: Hi Anita! Well, they are convenient. I like that I can study from the comfort of my home. What about you?

Anita: I agree on the convenience, but I find it hard to concentrate sometimes. There are so many distractions at home.

Sameer: That's true. Also, the lack of face-to-face interaction with teachers is a big disadvantage. It's difficult to ask questions and have discussions.

Anita: Exactly! And the internet connection is not always reliable. I missed half of the science class yesterday because of a network issue.

Sameer: Oh, that's a problem. However, I think learning to use these digital tools is a great skill for our future. It makes us more independent learners.

Anita: I suppose so. It's a mixed experience, with both good and bad sides.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले अनलाइन कक्षाहरूका फाइदा र बेफाइदाहरू बारे दुई साथीहरू बीचको संवाद प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले सुविधा, एकाग्रताको कमी, शिक्षकसँगको अन्तरक्रियाको अभाव, र प्राविधिक समस्याहरू जस्ता विषयहरूलाई समेट्छ। संवादले सन्तुलित दृष्टिकोण प्रस्तुत गर्दछ र कम्तिमा छ आदानप्रदानको आवश्यकता पूरा गर्दछ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents a dialogue between two friends discussing the pros and cons of online classes. It covers points like convenience, lack of concentration, absence of teacher interaction, and technical issues. The dialogue offers a balanced view and fulfills the requirement of at least six exchanges. Citations: chapter 11, page 171.

questions.title: Write a short biography of a person you admire (e.g., a famous scientist, artist, or social worker) in about 200 words.

sampleAnswer.title: Anuradha Koirala: A Mother to Many
sampleAnswer.content:
Anuradha Koirala, born on April 14, 1949, is a renowned Nepali social activist and the founder of Maiti Nepal, a non-profit organization dedicated to helping victims of sex trafficking. Her early life was spent in different parts of Nepal, and she pursued her education in India. Witnessing the plight of trafficked girls and women inspired her to take action.

In 1993, she established Maiti Nepal with her own savings. Her major contribution has been the rescue and rehabilitation of thousands of trafficking survivors. Maiti Nepal provides a safe home, education, vocational training, and legal support to them. Koirala faced numerous challenges, including threats from traffickers and lack of resources, but her determination never wavered.

For her incredible work, she has received numerous national and international awards, including the prestigious CNN Hero of the Year award in 2010. I admire Anuradha Koirala for her immense courage, compassion, and selfless dedication. She has given a new life and hope to countless individuals, proving that one person's commitment can bring about a monumental change in society. She is truly an inspiration.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले अनुराधा कोइरालाको जीवनी प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले उनको जन्म, प्रारम्भिक जीवन, माइती नेपालको स्थापना, मुख्य योगदान, सामना गरेका चुनौतीहरू, र प्राप्त पुरस्कारहरू जस्ता मुख्य पक्षहरूलाई समेट्छ। अन्त्यमा, लेखकले उनको प्रशंसा गर्नुको कारण उल्लेख गर्दछ, जसले जीवनीलाई व्यक्तिगत स्पर्श दिन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer provides a biography of Anuradha Koirala. It covers key aspects like her birth, early life, the founding of Maiti Nepal, her major contributions, challenges faced, and awards received. The conclusion states why the writer admires her, adding a personal touch to the biography. Citations: chapter 15, page 248.

questions.title: Reproduce the following sentences as instructed in the brackets.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Someone is following us. (Change into passive voice.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: We are being followed.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: वर्तमान निरन्तर काल (is/are + v-ing) लाई passive voice मा परिवर्तन गर्दा, संरचना 'object + is/are + being + v3' हुन्छ। 'by someone' लाई प्रायः हटाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To change a present continuous tense (is/are + v-ing) sentence into the passive voice, the structure becomes 'object + is/are + being + v3'. 'by someone' is usually omitted. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: She has to finish the work, __________? (Add a correct question tag.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She has to finish the work, doesn't she?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: वाक्यमा 'has to' ले मुख्य क्रियाको रूपमा काम गर्दछ (simple present tense)। यसको सहायक क्रिया 'does' हो। वाक्य सकारात्मक भएकोले, ट्याग नकारात्मक ('doesn't she?') हुन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: In the sentence, 'has to' functions as a main verb (simple present tense). The auxiliary is 'does'. Since the statement is positive, the tag is negative ('doesn't she?'). Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The teacher said, "The Earth revolves around the Sun." (Change into indirect speech.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The teacher said that the Earth revolves around the Sun.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: यो एक विश्वव्यापी सत्य (universal truth) हो, त्यसैले अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा परिवर्तन गर्दा क्रियाको काल परिवर्तन हुँदैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: This is a universal truth, so the tense of the verb does not change when converting to indirect speech. Citations: chapter 1, page 14.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: If you don't hurry, you ________ (miss) the bus. (Use the correct form of the verb 'miss' to complete the sentence.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: If you don't hurry, you will miss the bus.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: यो पहिलो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो (If + simple present, ...simple future), जसले भविष्यको सम्भावित परिणामलाई जनाउँछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 1 conditional sentence (If + simple present, ...simple future), which refers to a real future possibility. Citations: chapter 5, page 75.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He seldom goes to the cinema. (Change into affirmative.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He often/sometimes/usually goes to the cinema. OR He goes to the cinema.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'Seldom' एक नकारात्मक अर्थ बोक्ने adverb हो। यसलाई हटाएर 'often' जस्तो affirmative adverb राख्दा वा केही नराख्दा वाक्य affirmative बन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: 'Seldom' is a negative adverb. The sentence can be made affirmative by replacing it with an affirmative adverb like 'often' or by simply removing it. Citations: chapter 11, page 183.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: She came here to meet her friend. (Change into 'Why' question.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Why did she come here?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: उद्देश्य ('to meet her friend') बारे प्रश्न सोध्न 'Why' को प्रयोग गरिन्छ र भूतकालको लागि सहायक क्रिया 'did' को साथ प्रश्न बनाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To ask about the purpose ('to meet her friend'), 'Why' is used, and a question is formed with the auxiliary verb 'did' for the simple past. Citations: chapter 18, page 301.

questions.title: Choose and copy the correct answers from the brackets to complete the given text. (Rewriting the text is not compulsory.)
questions.passage: There are many historical places in Nepal, (a) _____ (is there/isn't there/are there/aren't there)? Bhaktapur Durbar Square is one of them. It (b) _____ (was listed/is listed/listed/had listed) as a World Heritage Site in 1979. A lot of tourists visit this place every year. If I were a tourist guide, I (c) _____ (will tell/would tell/would have told/had told) them about its history. The guide said that the palace (d) _____ (is/was/has been/had been) built in the 15th century. He asked me (e) _____ (if I know/if I knew/do I know/did I know) about the 55-window palace. The local authority has made the visitors (f) _____ (to follow/follow/followed/following) certain rules. (g) _____ (Despite/Although/Because of/Because) the earthquake of 2015, the site still holds its ancient charm. Many buildings (h) _____ (were destroyed/destroyed/had destroyed/are destroyed) by the earthquake. The government is working hard (i) _____ (renovate/to renovate/renovating/renovated) the damaged structures. I spent (j) _____ (a/an/the/no article) whole day exploring the area.

gaps.explanationNepali: वाक्य 'There are...' सकारात्मक छ, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग नकारात्मक ('aren't') र सर्वनाम 'there' हुनुपर्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The statement 'There are...' is positive, so the tag must be negative ('aren't') with the pronoun 'there'. Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो कार्य भूतकाल (1979) मा भएको हो र वाक्य passive voice मा छ, त्यसैले simple past passive ('was listed') को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The action happened in the past (1979) and is in the passive voice, so the simple past passive ('was listed') is used. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो दोस्रो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो (If + simple past, ...would + v1), जसले एक काल्पनिक अवस्थालाई जनाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 2 conditional sentence (If + simple past, ...would + v1), referring to a hypothetical situation. Citations: chapter 5, page 75.

gaps.explanationNepali: अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा, रिपोर्टिङ क्रिया (said) भूतकालमा भएकोले, क्रियालाई पनि भूतकाल (was) मा परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In indirect speech, since the reporting verb (said) is in the past, the verb is also changed to the past tense (was). Citations: chapter 1, page 8.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो एक अप्रत्यक्ष yes/no प्रश्न हो। रिपोर्टिङ क्रिया (asked) भूतकालमा भएकोले, क्रिया 'know' लाई पनि भूतकाल ('knew') मा परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is an indirect yes/no question. Since the reporting verb (asked) is in the past, the verb 'know' is also changed to the past tense ('knew'). Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'make' को causative रूपमा, यसपछि object ('the visitors') र bare infinitive ('follow') आउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In the causative form with 'make', it is followed by an object ('the visitors') and the bare infinitive ('follow'). Citations: chapter 18, page 307.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'Although' ले विरोधाभास देखाउँछ: भूकम्प गए तापनि, साइटले आफ्नो पुरानो आकर्षण कायम राखेको छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'Although' introduces a contrast: despite the earthquake, the site still holds its charm. Citations: chapter 13, page 225.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो वाक्य passive voice मा छ र भूतकालको घटनालाई जनाउँछ, त्यसैले 'were + v3' को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a passive voice sentence referring to a past event, so the structure 'were + v3' is used. Citations: chapter 10, page 172.

gaps.explanationNepali: उद्देश्य जनाउनको लागि 'to' + infinitive को प्रयोग गरिन्छ (The government is working hard for what purpose? To renovate...).
gaps.explanationEnglish: The 'to' + infinitive form is used to express purpose (The government is working hard for what purpose? To renovate...). Citations: chapter 18, page 302.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'whole' शब्द व्यञ्जन ध्वनि /h/ बाट सुरु हुन्छ, त्यसैले article 'a' को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The word 'whole' begins with a consonant sound /h/, so the article 'a' is used. Citations: chapter 7, page 120.
